Changing Log-on Information

When a security breach occurs, you can use the Logon tab to change the name a user uses to log onto the application or to change the user's password.

Note: You can perform this function only on servers that are currently running.

To change a user's log-on name or password:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    These actions display the Server Administration dialog.

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane.  If you have not yet logged onto the server configuration, you will be asked to do so. If you are using the client, you can administer remote servers only.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Accounts bar in the lower left panel. Then click the User Manager shortcut.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Accounts > User Manager.

    The User Manager dialog opens.

  4. By default, the All Users group is selected, and all user names are displayed in the Users pane.

  5. Select the user's name in the Users pane.

  6. Right-click to open the context menu, and select Properties. This action displays the User Properties dialog.

  7. Select the Logon tab.

  8. If desired, enter a new log-on name in the Name text box.

  9. Select either the Validate through StarTeam Server or Validate through directory service button. The application supports both Microsoft Active Directory and OpenLDAP. For users to be validated against the directory server, the Server must be on a trusted domain in relation to that server. The Enable directory service option and location and port number of the port number must also be entered on the Directory Service tab of the Server Configuration dialog.  

  10. If the user will be validated through the StarTeam Server and requires a new password:

    • Enter a new password for the user in the Password text box.

    • Enter the password again in the Confirm text box.

  11. If the user will be validated through directory service, enter the user's Distinguished name (unique identifier for a directory service user).

  12. Click OK. The new log-on name and/or password will become effective the next time the user logs onto the application.
